results.title: Two out of five
results.creator_credit: Francine Vande Wiele, Jean Calvell and Unesco
results.brief_description: Two out of five of the world’s population cannot read or write, and the campaign to promote literacy is of great importance for economic and social development. Scenes in African and Asian countries illustrate the great efforts being made in many underdeveloped areas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Francine Vande Wiele, Jean Calvell and Unesco

results.title: Two mountain lands: Andes and Alps
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes, Audio Visual Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the life of a Swiss Alpine dairy farmer with that of a terrace farmer from the Peruvian Andes. Shows differences in farming methods, transportation systems, traditions and economic structures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew B. Nemes, Audio Visual Productions and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Two men of Fiji
results.creator_credit: Brett Porter, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Jaile and Adriu lived on Kakeba Island in the Lay group.Adriu left to study medicine in Suva and his friend Jaile crept away to join him. But Jaile soon found that life in Suva was lonely and difficult for an island boy. Back home he found his place again, working among things he knew, with his friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brett Porter, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit

results.title: Two grasslands: Texas and Iran
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Compares the Edwards Plateau in Texas and the steppes of Iran as regions similar in rainfall pattern and sparsity of vegetation. Explores the lifestyles of the people of the two regions to reveal the interrelationship between land, technology and culture.

results.title: Two eight bravo
results.creator_credit: James M. Olsson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Grahame Jennings Productions
results.brief_description: An army recruitment film which captures the drama of battle. A tank hits a land-mine in Vietnam, and we follow the journey of the crippled tank back to Australia where repairs begin. Young Army apprentices, in training, learn how to repair tanks, aircraft and modern equipment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James M. Olsson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Grahame Jennings Productions

results.title: Two deserts: Sahara and Sonora
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes and Audio Visual Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Shows what characteristics the Sahara Desert in Africa and the Sonora Desert in North America have in common, and explains how factors of economics, religion, culture and technology make the regions different.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrew B. Nemes and Audio Visual Productions

results.title: Two decades
results.creator_credit: N.V.K. Murty and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The history of India since the end of British Colonial rule, and the beginning of the end of colonial rule all over the world. Highlights are the passing of great men; the achievement of internal unity in spite of religious and class differences. Five year plans have changed the face of India but much remains to be achieved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: N.V.K. Murty and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Two cities: London and New York
results.creator_credit: Helen Jean Secondari, John H. Secondari, John H Secondari Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: A comparison of the quality of life and approach to urban problems of two western English speaking capital cities. Varied in their ethnic make up, cultural traditions, physical layout and community organisation, London and New York offer very different advantages and problems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Helen Jean Secondari, John H. Secondari, John H Secondari Productions and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: Two Chinese dancers
results.creator_credit: Wan-go Wen and Chinese Film Enterprises of America
results.brief_description: Miss Tai Ai-Lien presents two traditional Chinese folk dances, the Yao ceremonial prelude which is used at marriages and funerals, and a solo dance drama called ‘The Mute and the Cripple’. There is no dialogue or commentary, these presentations of little-known Chinese dances are accompanied by authentic folk music played on flute and drums.

results.title: Two brothers in Greece
results.brief_description: Looks at two Greek brothers, one who remains in the village of Peloponnesus to continue farming, thus helping his brother financially as he goes to engineering school, while the other runs a tourist boat through the Greek Isles.
results.description: Looks at two Greek brothers, one who remains in the village of Peloponnesus to continue farming, thus helping his brother financially as he goes to engineering school, while the other runs a tourist boat through the Greek Isles.
